amendment.description: An amendment numbered 30 printed in Part C of House Report 117-125 to require the suspension of U.S. sustainment and maintenance support to Saudi air force units responsible for airstrikes resulting in civilian casualties in Yemen with certain exemptions for territorial self-defense, counterterrorism operations, and defense of U.S. government facilities or personnel.
amendment.purpose: Amendment requires the suspension of U.S. sustainment and maintenance support to Saudi air force units responsible for airstrikes resulting in civilian casualties in Yemen with certain exemptions for territorial self-defense, counterterrorism operations, and defense of U.S. government facilities or personnel.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Meeks amendment (A018) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 204 (Roll no. 279).

action.text: The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A018) pursuant to the rule.
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A018) offered by Mr. Meeks.
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment agreed to by House: On agreeing to the Meeks amendment (A018) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 204 (Roll no. 279).
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Meeks amendment (A018) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 204 (Roll no. 279).
